Lack of credible sources: The essay claiming to be Steve Jobs' deathbed essay was not published by any credible sources or confirmed by anyone close to him. It only circulated on unofficial social media accounts and low-traffic blogs.
Late appearance of the essay: The essay did not begin circulating online until November 2015, four years after Steve Jobs' death in 2011. The delayed appearance raises questions about its authenticity and credibility.
Inconsistencies with Steve Jobs: known beliefs: The essay talks about the negative effects of pursuing wealth, which contradicts Steve Jobs' known emphasis on innovation, success, and entrepreneurship. This inconsistency raises doubts about the essay's authenticity.
Lack of corroboration: No other reliable sources or individuals have confirmed the existence of this deathbed essay by Steve Jobs. The absence of corroboration undermines the credibility of the claim.
